questions.question: What are the four types of models of competition?

answers.a: Perfect Competition, Monopoly, Monopolistic Competition, Oligopoly
answers.b: Perfect Competition, Monopoly, Monopolistic Competition, Monopsony
answers.d: Perfect Competition, Monopoly, Monopolistic Competition, Perfect Monopoly

questions.question: Which type of market structure has a large number of buyers and sellers?
What is the main characteristic of a monopoly market structure?
What type of competition is characterized by a few large firms producing a homogeneous or differentiated product?
What is the main characteristic of perfect competition?
What is the demand curve faced by a perfectly competitive firm?
What is the marginal revenue curve for a perfectly competitive firm?
What is the main characteristic of a monopoly?
What is the demand curve faced by a monopolist?
What is the main characteristic of monopolistic competition?
What is the main characteristic of oligopoly?
What is the kinked demand curve in oligopoly?

answers.a: A demand curve with a kink at the prevailing price level
answers.b: A demand curve with no kink at the prevailing price level
answers.c: A demand curve with a kink at the highest price level
answers.d: A demand curve with a kink at the lowest price level

answers.a: A pricing method where the price is set based on the cost of production plus a markup
answers.b: A pricing method where the price is set based on the demand for the product
answers.c: A pricing method where the price is set based on the supply of the product
answers.d: A pricing method where the price is set based on the competition

answers.a: A pricing method where the price is set based on the desired return on investment
answers.b: A pricing method where the price is set based on the cost of production
answers.c: A pricing method where the price is set based on the demand for the product
answers.d: A pricing method where the price is set based on the supply of the product

answers.a: A pricing method where the price is set low to attract customers and gain market share
answers.b: A pricing method where the price is set high to maximize profits
answers.c: A pricing method where the price is set based on the cost of production
answers.d: A pricing method where the price is set based on the demand for the product

answers.b: A pricing method where the price is set high to maximize profits

answers.d: A pricing method where the price is set based on the demand for the product
